title: Xabi Alonso set to announce retirement at the end of the season
text:
END OF AN ERA Xabi Alonso set to announce retirement at the end of the season 
Champions League hero ready to hang up his boots when his current deal at Bayern Munich expires this summer By DUNCAN WRIGHT Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments LIVERPOOL legend Xabi Alonso is set to announce his retirement from football at the end of the season. 
Alonso’s current deal with Bayern Munich runs out this summer and the former Spain international is now expected to bring an end to his glittering career. Press Association 4 Xabi Alonso is a Liverpool hero after his part in helping the club to Champions League glory in 2005 
The 35-year-old has gone down in Anfield history for his part in the Champions League victory over AC Milan in 2005. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Liverpool news , gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Alonso arrived at Liverpool in a £10.5million deal from Real Sociedad in August 2004, and won the Champions League in his first season. Getty Images 4 Xabi Alonso celebrates with his Real Madrid team-mates after they beat Barcelona to win the 2011 Copa Del Ray 
The cultured midfielder scored the crucial equalising goal in Istanbul as the Reds came back from 3-0 down at half-time to beat Milan on penalties. 
He was, by some distance, the best central midfielder I ever played alongside. Steven Gerrard on Xabi Alonso 
Alonso was a huge favourite with the Anfield crowd and went on to win the FA Cup in 2006 as part of the side that beat West Ham on penalties in a thrilling final in Cardiff. 
The midfielder continued his success after his £30million move to Real Madrid in 2009, helping the Spanish giants to a La Liga title in 2012 and Champions League glory in 2014. Zabi Alsono set to retire from football after glittering Liverpool, Real Madrid and Bayern career Getty Images 4 Xabi Alonso's is expected to retire when Bayern Munich deal runs out at the end of the season 
He won the Bundesliga in his first two years with Bayern, and is hoping to help the club to a hat-trick of titles this season. 
Alonso's success was not just limited to club football - he was a World Cup winner with Spain in 2010 and also lifted two European Championship titles with his country. 
Former Liverpool teammate Steven Gerrard has no doubt about the quality of Alonso - hailing him as royalty. 
Writing in his autobiography, Gerrard said: "It was clear Alonso was royalty after our first training session together and Rafa Benitez, who had been so clever to buy him in the first place, was equally stupid to sell him to Real Madrid five years later.
